items.sentence: I almost wish that I were going to Boston with you.
I wanted to see if you\'d heard anything about Tom.
Oh, sorry, I didn\'t know it was against the rules.
Neither Tom nor Mary has been helping us with that.
Tom seems to be having a little difficulty in math.
Tom never told Mary about what he did that weekend.
Tom never told me that he knew how to speak French.
Tom occasionally visited me when I lived in Boston.
Tom already knows that Mary is planning to do that.
Tom decided that he didn\'t really like doing that.
Tom doesn\'t speak French well and I don\'t either.
My stomach aches so much that I can\'t fall asleep.
Is this how you want to live the rest of your life?
Is your French good enough to explain how to do it?
It might be very hard for me to be alone right now.
Are there any girls here that you haven\'t met yet?
Tom asked Mary if she knew who John was married to.
Tom was about to be killed, but he didn\'t know it.
I don\'t think that Tom knows who did that for him.
I don\'t think that the police will ever catch Tom.
It would be better if you didn\'t go outside today.
Tom told everyone that Mary couldn\'t speak French.
Why have you never said anything about this before?
Why didn\'t you ever tell me how you felt about me?
Why don\'t you just do it now and get it over with?
I don\'t often get home on Monday until about 2:30.
Why is everybody making such a big deal about this?
I told Tom you weren\'t going to be there tomorrow.
I couldn\'t have gotten this far without your help.
I couldn\'t help but overhear what you said to Tom.
I couldn\'t think of anything else I wanted to buy.
I couldn\'t think of anything else I wanted to say.
Whose car was that that you were driving yesterday?
Tom posted a picture of himself with his shirt off.
Tom had trouble focusing on what needed to be done.
How did you like those sandwiches we had for lunch?
I would\'ve done anything in the world to help Tom.
I\'m fairly certain Tom doesn\'t have any siblings.
Tom told everyone that he was desperate to do that.
Tom could tell that Mary didn\'t enjoy the concert.
Tom expected Mary to show up on Saturday afternoon.
Mary advised Tom to save a little money each month.
Tom is the one who\'s likely to be able to do that.
We don\'t hang out together as often as we used to.
Tom was the only one who could answer the question.
Tom was wearing a Santa hat at the Christmas party.
Tom will be staying with his cousin over Christmas.
What happened to Tom? I haven\'t seen him recently.
This tree is considered sacred by the local people.
I like both Tom and Mary, but I think Tom is nicer.
